security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Analyze code for TanStack library adoption opportunities
content.value_statement: Web applications often overuse libraries before understanding their actual benefits. This skill provides strategic prompts to identify where TanStack libraries (Query, Table, Form, Router) genuinely improve working code.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes codebases for TanStack Query opportunities in data fetching
Identifies table and grid components suited for TanStack Table
Evaluates form complexity for TanStack Form adoption
Reviews routing patterns for TanStack Router use cases
Provides decision criteria for library adoption timing
Includes reusable prompts for focused analysis
limitations: Does not implement TanStack code changes automatically
Does not install or configure TanStack dependencies
Does not execute code or modify project files
Does not provide runtime debugging or testing

use_cases.title: Evaluate existing React codebases
use_cases.description: Analyze production code to identify where TanStack libraries would reduce complexity

use_cases.title: Guide team adoption strategy
use_cases.description: Establish patterns for when to introduce TanStack libraries in new projects

use_cases.title: Review code quality
use_cases.description: Identify over-engineered patterns or premature optimization in web applications

prompt_templates.title: Full project analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze entire codebase for TanStack opportunities
prompt_templates.prompt: Look through the ENTIRE project and look for areas where, if we leveraged one of the many TanStack libraries (e.g., query, table, forms, etc), we could make part of the code much better, simpler, more performant, more maintainable, elegant, shorter, more reliable, etc.

prompt_templates.title: Query-focused analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Look through the project for data fetching patterns that would benefit from TanStack Query. Consider caching needs, refetching patterns, and optimistic updates. Identify the top 3 opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Table-focused analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Look through the project for table/grid components that would benefit from TanStack Table. Consider sorting, filtering, pagination, and column management needs. Identify candidates.

prompt_templates.title: Form-focused analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze form handling in the project. Identify complex forms with multi-step workflows, dynamic fields, or async validation that would benefit from TanStack Form.

output_examples.input: Analyze my Next.js app for TanStack adoption opportunities
output: TanStack Query recommended for: user dashboard (caching benefits), notifications (background refetching), data tables (pagination)
TanStack Table recommended for: user list component with sorting and filtering
TanStack Form recommended for: multi-step registration wizard
Skip: Simple contact form (3 fields), static data tables (<20 rows)

best_practices: Start with vanilla implementations and only adopt TanStack when complexity justifies the benefit
Use ultrathink mode with Claude Code Opus 4.5 or Codex GPT 5.2 for thorough analysis
Evaluate each suggested adoption individually rather than adopting all libraries at once
anti_patterns: Installing all TanStack libraries at project start without proven need
Applying TanStack patterns to simple cases where vanilla solutions work well
Ignoring the learning curve and team familiarity with TanStack libraries

faq.question: Which TanStack libraries should I install first?
faq.answer: Start with TanStack Query for data fetching. Only add Table, Form, Router, or Virtual when you identify specific pain points in your code.

faq.question: When is the right time to adopt TanStack?
faq.answer: After your feature works well in vanilla. The skill recommends running analysis prompts once the application is already functional.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides analysis prompts only. You decide which recommendations to implement manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution. No data leaves your environment when using the provided prompts.

faq.question: How does this compare to using TanStack documentation?
faq.answer: The skill provides analysis prompts that scan your specific codebase for opportunities. Documentation explains what TanStack does, but this skill helps you find where to apply it.

faq.question: Can I use this with vanilla JavaScript projects?
faq.answer: The prompts work with any codebase. TanStack libraries work with React and Solid, so benefits are clearest in those frameworks.
